quotes: between 2015 and 2019, only 1.4 percent of the estimated USD 175 billion needed annually to achieve Sustainable Development Goal 14 was mobilized.

organizations.name: Third United Nations Ocean Conference (UNOC3)
quotes: At the Third United Nations Ocean Conference (UNOC3), the United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF) underscored the urgent need to build a more coordinated, inclusive, and scalable approach to ocean finance.

organizations.name: United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF)
quotes: the United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF) underscored the urgent need to build a more coordinated, inclusive, and scalable approach to ocean finance.

organizations.name: Ocean Action Panel
quotes: Speaking during the Ocean Action Panel on financing SDG14, UNCDF Executive Secretary Pradeep Kurukulasuriya highlighted between 2015 and 2019, only 1.4 percent of the estimated USD 175 billion needed annually to achieve Sustainable Development Goal 14 was mobilized.

organizations.name: Global Fund for Coral Reefs
quotes: Through the Global Fund for Coral Reefs, UNCDF has helped mobilize over USD 300 million in grant and investment capital to support reef-positive solutions in 21 countries.

organizations.name: Plastics Transition Investment Facility
quotes: UNCDF is co-developing the Plastics Transition Investment Facility with IFC and UNEP, applying blended finance tools to unlock private capital for circular solutions across the plastics value chain.

organizations.name: One Ocean Finance Facility
quotes: UNCDF and a coalition of UN organizations and partners have launched the co-design process for the One Ocean Finance Facility—an ambitious effort to pool contributions from ocean-dependent industries and channel them through fit-for-purpose blended finance structures that support country-led priorities and deliver equitable outcomes.

organizations.name: UNDP
quotes: UNCDF—including UNDP, UNEP, UN Global Compact, UN DESA, UNCTAD, UNESCO-IOC, UNWTO, IUCN, and WRI—invites Member States, development partners, industry, and civil society to join this effort to build a more coherent and scalable blended finance architecture dedicated to the ocean.

organizations.name: UNEP
quotes: UNCDF is co-developing the Plastics Transition Investment Facility with IFC and UNEP, applying blended finance tools to unlock private capital for circular solutions across the plastics value chain.

supporting_quotes: the United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF) underscored the urgent need to build a more coordinated, inclusive, and scalable approach to ocean finance.
Through the Global Fund for Coral Reefs, UNCDF has helped mobilize over USD 300 million in grant and investment capital to support reef-positive solutions in 21 countries.
UNCDF is co-developing the Plastics Transition Investment Facility with IFC and UNEP, applying blended finance tools to unlock private capital for circular solutions across the plastics value chain.

UNCDF and a coalition of UN organizations and partners have launched the co-design process for the One Ocean Finance Facility—an ambitious effort to pool contributions from ocean-dependent industries and channel them through fit-for-purpose blended finance structures that support country-led priorities and deliver equitable outcomes.

UNCDF—including UNDP, UNEP, UN Global Compact, UN DESA, UNCTAD, UNESCO-IOC, UNWTO, IUCN, and WRI—invites Member States, development partners, industry, and civil society to join this effort to build a more coherent and scalable blended finance architecture dedicated to the ocean.
UNCDF is co-developing the Plastics Transition Investment Facility with IFC and UNEP, applying blended finance tools to unlock private capital for circular solutions across the plastics value chain.
